page.title: 10Burrow Mump
page.content: On Burrow Mump there used to be a fort.The fort was there to defend Athelney Abbey. It was a good place to build a fort as you can see for miles around when you stand on top of the Mump. People think that the Romans may have been there because Roman coins have been found in the churchyard. The fortress was pulled down in the 15th century and a chapel was built. In the Civil War some of the King's men sheltered there and the chapel was damaged when they were driven out. In 1750 they decided to rebuild the chapel but it was never quite finished. The Mump now belongs to the National Trust. There is a small car park at the side and a stile to climb. Although it is a small hill it is quite steep to climb.
